alert.note: Alert for Gunnison; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 5:26PM MDT until August 01 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Gunnison County in west central Colorado... West Central Pitkin County in west central Colorado... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 526 PM MDT, satellite estimates indicate thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 0.6 to 1.1 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Satellite estimates. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Areas along Hwy 133 south ofRedstone. Mud and debris slides across Highway 133 south of Redstone are possible. FLASH FLOOD...SATELLITE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.6-1.1 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
